result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery S Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked, the sentence may be served with huber.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

-AODA and any follow-up

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:20 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Traci Koziczkowski not present in court.  FTP $443.00.  Statement by defendant.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends the defendant's probation for 1 year.  Court instructs defendant that if not paid by the next discharge date the court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:22 p.m.
Probation review hearing on April 17, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
1:48 P.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb privat .  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with probation.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

30 days county jail, with huber stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up
-No Contact with the victim.
-20 hours of community service
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent .
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 1:54 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:52 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer that defendant will accept.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on May 10, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.  

Court adjourned at 2:53 p.m.
Status hearing on April 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 14, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:14 a.m.

Defendant called, stated he didn't know anything about this but was on the internet.  Defendant requested an adjournment.  Matter adjourned to March 1, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.
